channel.title: supply chain on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in supply chain on FinanClub

item.title: Supply Chain Latest: Paper Mills and Economic Activity
item.description: Economic Activity Slowing Down? A new article from the KPMG Supply Chain Institute suggests that there are signs that economic activity is slowing down. The article cites several data points, including: Paper mills are operating at about 70% capacity, which is down from 90% to 92% capacity when the economy is running smoothly.

item.title: Supply Chain Latest: India Decoupling From China
item.description: India Decouples From China India is increasingly decoupling from China in terms of its supply chains. This is due to a number of factors, including the ongoing trade war between the United States and China, as well as India’s own economic growth and ambitions.

item.title: U.S. Delivers Early Win in Asia Trade Pact, But Rifts Surface
item.description: The U.S. and 13 other Asia-Pacific nations have agreed to expand supply-chain cooperation in a move aimed at strengthening economic ties in the region and countering China’s growing influence. The pact, which was announced at the Detroit Economic Club by U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai and Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi, includes provisions for cooperation on supply chain resilience, digital trade, and labor standards.
